result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raequan S May

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Raequan S May in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Raequan S May in custody.    Student Intern Daniel Murphy under the supervision of Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, case is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing in case#s 15CM1214 & 15CF3233.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Raequan S May not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court via telephone, defendant Raequan S May not in court, in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense attorney is very ill and requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Raequan S May not in court, in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant has pending felonies before Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defense would like to try and resolve this case with the pending felonies.  With the clerk's permission, Court ordered case transferred to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Raequan S May in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Defendant Raequan S May in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court previously ordered a Bench Warrant on 07-28-2015. Court will continue the bench warrant.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($25.00) gj
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 25.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court earlier.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Defendant failing to appear and comply with JusticePoint, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  Clerk was unable to contact attorney Patrick Wait to address violation.  Court ordered the defendant to appear on July 28, 2015 at 1:30 pm.  Clerk notified attorney Patrick Wait by text of the scheduled court date.

15RM032238  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-05-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Wisconsin Conservatory of Life Learning

Defendant Raequan S May in court with Student Intern Nicole Brandemuehl under the supervision of attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Raequan S May in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
